revised_title: Homotopy Invariants and Continuous Mappings: A New Approach
tldr: This article introduces new numerical invariants called secondary torsions, which, along with Betti numbers and coefficients of torsion, help characterize the homotopy type of a certain class of polyhedra. These invariants are also applied to classify continuous mappings of an n-dimensional polyhedron into an n-sphere. The study provides a new approach to understanding the topology of polyhedra and their mappings.
